result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glenn Anthony Cannataro

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Glenn Anthony Cannataro in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Stevens in court for Glenn Anthony Cannataro.  Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
3:22 p.m.
Prelim Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
Atty Stevens ready to proceed to Arraignment if Information will track Complaint.
ADA provides copy of proposed Info - will efile today.
Atty Stevens agrees Info tracks Complaint.
Waives reading - enters not guilty pleas.
3:27 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Glenn Anthony Cannataro in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Stevens appeared by Zoom video for Glenn Anthony Cannataro.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
3:09 p.m.
Atty Stevens requests Deft's phone number - was not able to contact.
Deft does not have a phone.
Atty Stevens requests address.
Deft's mother speaks.
Deft provides mother's number - confirms address.
Atty Stevens requests adjournment to discuss proceeding w/Deft.
Court reschedules hrg.
Atty Stevens will appear in person.
3:16 p.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Glenn Anthony Cannataro in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Stevens not in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
3:33 p.m.
Deft tried to call atty this morning - has not heard from atty in a couple weeks.
Atty Heineck has not received response from Atty Stevens to offer.
Court changes 09/28 Arraignment date to Prelim/Arraignment.
3:36 p.m.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:10 AM Defendant Glenn Anthony Cannataro appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Thomas Stevens appeared by ZOOM for Glenn Anthony Cannataro.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Stevens heard.
Copy of complaint.
Has reviewed charges with Deft.
Deft understands.
Requests prelim.
Deft waives time limits.
Court schedules with parties.
Court reviews new process with Atty Stevens.
Atty Stevens understands.
9:15 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:15 AM Defendant Glenn Anthony Cannataro appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - deft understands charges and max penalties.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no contact with Holy Smokes Shop or R.O-B, may not go into any state where THC is legal. 
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
9:20 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
